page.title: 17Craft in Morchard Bishop
page.content: Painting,sketching and calligraphy are taught at an evening class in the village school during the Winter months.The Women's Institute has a county home economics section holding day classes once a quarter on patchwork,macrame,pewter work and paper flower making or whatever craft is requested by the members.A monthly meeting is held in the village hall for flower arranging.In recent years there has been a revival of making garments from the fleece,shorn and spun from local sheep,especially the Jacobs breed.Some being sold in local markets.Other hobbies include cake decoration,pottery,sculpture,wood carving and the making of stained glass.
